data.title: Leadership at Irvine Company
data.meta_description: Irvine Company Chairman Donald Bren has assembled a team of the real estate industry’s most experienced and proven executives.
data.text:
Donald Bren, Chairman of the Board of Irvine Company, has been deeply involved in California real estate as a master planner and a master builder for over 50 years.

Born in Los Angeles, California, Bren earned a degree in economics and business administration from the University of Washington. Following his education, he served three years as an officer in the U.S. Marine Corps.

Bren joined the Mission Viejo Company in 1963 as president, initiating the master planning and master building of the 11,000-acre new community of Mission Viejo, California. In 1967, Bren sold his interest in the Mission Viejo Company to expand his activities in new master-planned communities within Southern California including Westlake Village and Newhall Ranch, and Foster City in the San Francisco Bay Area.

In 1977, Bren became a member of the investment group that purchased Irvine Company from the Irvine Foundation. Bren was elected Chairman of the Board in 1983 and later became the principal shareholder.

During the last 40 years, under Bren’s leadership and vision, the Irvine Company has professionally planned and master built the all-new City of Irvine and the Newport Coast, creating one of America’s most desirable regions. The City of Irvine currently has a population of more than 300,000, growing to an estimated 325,000 people over the next 10 years, with an equal number of employment positions.

Philanthropy

Bren maintains a long tradition of philanthropy and environmental stewardship, supporting causes ranging from environmental preservation to education and scientific research.

Business Week has recognized Bren as one of America’s top philanthropists. His total philanthropic giving is in excess of $2.1 Billion. The European London Times recognized him as one of the top 10 people in the world for his vision and contributions to green and environmental causes.

Endowed over 60 permanent distinguished professor chairs at the University of California and California Institute of Technology.

Principal financial contributor of Caltech’s Space-based Solar Power Project.

Founded one of the nation’s first graduate-level environmental schools, the Donald Bren School of Environmental Science and Management at University of California, Santa Barbara.

Initiated the University of California’s first dedicated school of computer science, the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences at University of California, Irvine.

Gifted more than 57,500 acres for permanently preserved open space and parklands network in the United States. It is the only land in California to receive both the California State and United States National Natural Landmark designation.

Honors

University of California Presidential Medal

California Institute of Technology’s Highest Honor

Marine Corps University Foundation’s General Leonard F. Chapman Jr. Medal

American Academy of Arts & Sciences Fellow

For an expanded biography, visit DonaldBren.com

Charles (Chip) Fedalen Jr. is President of Irvine Company. Mr. Fedalen works closely with the Chairman on strategy, organization and the long term focus of the company. He also oversees the corporate support functions. Mr. Fedalen, who serves on the Executive Management Committee, joined the company in 2014.

Previously, Mr. Fedalen served as Executive Vice President and Group Head for Wells Fargo Commercial Real Estate’s institutional lending platform in the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom. He also served on Wells Fargo’s Management Committee.

Mr. Fedalen is a past trustee of the Urban Land Institute. Mr. Fedalen also served as a Captain in the United States Army Reserve.

Mr. Fedalen holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of California, Los Angeles, with a double major in Scandinavian languages and political science. He also attended the University of Lund in Sweden. Mr. Fedalen received his law degree from the University of Southern California.

Marc Ley is Chief Financial Officer for Irvine Company and serves on the company’s Executive Management Committee. In his role, he is responsible for the company’s Corporate Finance, Tax, and Financial Services groups, in addition to directly managing the company’s Investment Division as Chief Investment Officer.

Mr. Ley joined the company in 1999 as Senior Vice President of Capital Markets and was promoted to Group SVP and Chief Financial Officer in 2001. In 2013, Mr. Ley was promoted to Executive Vice President and Chief Investment Officer, focusing his attention on building and leading the company’s Investment Division, which is responsible for managing the company’s investment portfolios and operations.

Prior to joining Irvine Company, Mr. Ley was employed by Pacific Life Insurance Company in Newport Beach, California, where he established its Real Estate Capital Markets division. Mr. Ley is a member of the National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts and has served on the advisory boards of several local nonprofit organizations.

Mr. Ley holds bachelor degrees in finance and in real estate from the University of Wisconsin, Madison and earned a master’s degree in real estate from the University of Wisconsin, Madison, where he was mentored by the late Dr. James A. Graaskamp.

Ken Gillett is President of Irvine Company’s Retail Properties. He is responsible for leading the best-in-class operations group with great diligence and care, driving the performance of 9M square feet of first-class shopping centers and community centers. He joined the company in 2012.

Mr. Gillett has nearly 35 years of retail and shopping center management experience, with 25 years in the property management arena. Ken’s professional career began in shopping centers as a retailer. With his keen retailer perspective as a foundation, Mr. Gillett transitioned to the operational and development side of the retail industry. Mr. Gillett’s career includes positions in specialty leasing, asset management and shopping center operations.

Mr. Gillett received his Certified Shopping Center Manager (CSM) designation from the International Center of Shopping Centers (ICSC) in 1995 and his Senior Certified Shopping Center Manager (SCSM) designation in 2004. He previously served as the Chairman of ICSC’s CSM Committee.

He graduated from the University of La Verne with a bachelor’s degree in business administration and currently resides in Laguna Hills, California.

Rob Elliott is Senior Vice President of Irvine Company’s Planning and Design Group. He is responsible for the overall planning and design of the company’s master planned communities including residential villages, apartment communities, and commercial centers (including office, retail, and hotel uses). Mr. Elliott joined in 1990 and has had an integral role in the planning of the new City of Irvine during his tenure.

Prior roles held by Mr. Elliott included tenure as Senior Vice President of Architecture and Design for Sunset Development Company where he guided the transformation of Bishop Ranch from a successful 10 million square foot office campus to a vibrant mixed use environment. Mr. Elliott also served as the Managing Principal for SWA Group, a world leader in landscape architecture, planning and urban design.

Mr. Elliott is active in a number of academic endeavors and serves as a Distinguished Fellow and Advisory Board Member with the Department of Planning, Policy and Design School of Social Ecology at the University of California, Irvine.

Mr. Elliott holds a bachelor’s degree in landscape architecture from Oregon State University. He also holds a master’s degree in landscape architecture and a master’s degree in urban design from Harvard University Graduate School of Design.

Mark Henigan is Group Senior Vice President, Financial Services, and Chief Accounting Officer. In this position, Mr. Henigan directs Irvine Company’s comprehensive accounting, payroll and internal audit operations.

Mr. Henigan joined Irvine Company as Senior Vice President of Financial and Information Services in 2006 and was promoted to his current position in 2009. From 2006 to 2012, Mr. Henigan was also responsible for the company’s Information Technology department. Prior to Irvine Company, he was an audit partner with the Real Estate Group of the international accounting firm Ernst & Young.

Mr. Henigan is a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants and the California Society of Certified Public Accountants, among other professional associations and organizations. He currently serves on the board of Families Forward, a local nonprofit organization serving families that are homeless or at risk of homelessness. He is a graduate of the University of California, Santa Barbara, where he received a degree in business economics with an emphasis in accounting.

Paul Hernandez is Senior Vice President of Corporate Affairs for Irvine Company. In his role, he is responsible for communications, government relations, regulatory and environmental affairs and real estate entitlement.

Prior to leading Corporate Affairs, Mr. Hernandez served as Vice President of Government Relations managing the company’s advocacy and public policy positions at the local, regional, state and federal levels of government.

Before joining Irvine Company in 2003, Mr. Hernandez was the West Coast Government Relations Manager for global defense and technology leader, Lockheed Martin IMS. Previously, he also served as Chief of Staff for an elected official on the Orange County Board of Supervisors.

Mr. Hernandez is a former member of the Board of Directors and Executive Committee of the California Business Roundtable and a past Executive Committee member of the California Building Industry Association. He holds a bachelor’s degree in political science from the University of California, Los Angeles, and is also a graduate of the CORO Foundation in Public Affairs.

Darren Thomas is Senior Vice President and head of Human Resources for Irvine Company. He is responsible for leading the company’s Human Resources strategy and oversees all aspects of the function, including talent acquisition, leadership development, training, compensation and benefits, HR information systems, and internal communications. Mr. Thomas joined Irvine Company in 2008.

During his career of more than 30 years, he has held leadership positions with several companies. Previously, he was Managing Director of Global Human Resources for Lehman Brothers Mortgage Banking Business. Earlier in his career, he held positions as Senior Vice President of Human Resources for Citigroup, Senior Vice President of Human Resources for Associates First Capital, and Senior Vice President for Alliance Data Systems, where he directed the firm’s global HR function.

Mr. Thomas has also worked with several nonprofits throughout his career, serving on boards for March of Dimes, YMCA and Big Brothers Big Sisters. He currently serves on the Board for United Cerebral Palsy of Orange County.

He holds a bachelor’s degree in economics from Colorado State University and earned an MBA from Southern Methodist University.

Abe Wong is Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer for Irvine Company. In his role, Mr. Wong is responsible for overseeing the strategy, innovation and execution for all aspects of the company’s technology functions including: customer and workforce solutions, corporate applications and analytics, IT portfolio management and service delivery, and digital customer solutions.

Prior to joining Irvine Company, Mr. Wong served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Information Officer for Viacom Media Networks & Paramount Pictures. He oversaw Viacom’s advanced marketing and advertising technologies to drive more efficient and effective campaigns. Mr. Wong also led successful efforts to enhance client and media services, marketing and sales systems, media content systems and technology solutions to support data and business intelligence and analytics.

Prior to Viacom & Paramount Pictures, Mr. Wong held roles including Head of Information Technology with Dreamworks SKG, Principal at Pittiglio, Rabin, Todd & McGrath consulting firm, and Regional Vice President with Divine, Inc. (formerly USWeb / CKS).

Mr. Wong holds a bachelor’s degree in engineering from Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, California.
